Portal 1 es un juego de puzzle interesante con una mecánica bastante divertida. Pero se siente como una demo del 2 en todo, tanto en lo técnico como en lo narrativo. Creo que debería tener un precio mas bajo.

Pretty short and straight-forward game. Pretty good. Not much complicated story and whatnot, just wasd and your mouse.

Portal is a classic. Its a fantastic immersive 3D puzzle game on the surface. But bellow that is a wonderfully humorous dialog and an eerie story line that just begs you to keep testing. There is no tutorial, the only way to learn is to test and the only way to win is keep testing. But the difficulty is very well scaled and quick to grasp. Overall great game, only downside is it is a bit on the short side in terms of play length and replay value is hit or miss depending on you. Still would recommend playing this cult classic wholeheartedly. 

*spoiler* there are hidden connections to other valve games if you look for them /*spoiler*

I really like this game. The atmosphere , lighting , graphics. I love it , you get the feeling you're alone. But not completely. GLaDOS brings the hallways of Aperture to life. So you don't get that feeling as much. But you do see traces of you being ' watched ' in certain test chambers where scientists are supposed to watch you. However , nobody is inside. This clearly hints that GLaDOS did something to the other people since you realize you're the only one in the facility.

I just beat it like 10 minutes ago, and trust me it was rly good. Most of the games that i like are because i played them as a kid with my brothers or something, but this is just a good game. It isnt very long but i think that makes it even better. I cant say I beat it in a day because i beat it in 3 hours. Its just funny in its own kind of way, like it feels as though the puzzles are just distractions from crazy robot lady. Also the end credits song is like really good.

I absolutely loved this game! Over the years, of course I have heard bits and pieces and references about the game but it did not at all take away my first time experiencing it. There's so much to this game and plenty of replay-ability. 
It is truly a timeless classic everyone should experience. :)

This game is one of my absolute favorites, I've played more times then I can count, honestly. Despite it's age, the game still makes me laugh. (Particularly GLADoS's sarcasm and line delivery is the game's main source of of humor) the story is entertaining, and a classic. (imo) the gameplay is immersive and fun, but still simple. overall, I definitely recommend Portal and it's sequel.
Portal is one of those games where you have to experience it to see why it's a great game.

Portal is a puzzle game set in a strange facility with a murderous AI system constantly monitoring your actions. The campaign is relatively "short and sweet" and was worth $10 to me. This game was released in 2007, and holds up well as of 2022. Actually, that's underselling it... Thousands of game developers took inspiration from Portal for a reason.

Игру можно пройти за 3-4 часа если же играть на все пасхалки то где то 5.5-6 часов. Рекомендую к покупке тем кто любит головоломки и тем кто к ним равнодушен а если игра по скидке берите не задумываясь  только помните что вас могут за проста унизить.                                                                                                                                      10/10 сьеденных тортов....

Eu acho que Portal é o jogo mais curioso da valve, além de ele possuir alguns dos puzzles mais complexos e criativos de qualquer jogo, ele se destaca no meio dos shooters violentos e frenéticos da Valve, é realmente bem interessante ver a direção em que a empresa partiu com esse jogo, visto que ele novamente apresenta uma mecânica extremamente impressionante para a época, os portais. Neste caso, o jogador toma posse de uma arma que dispara portais, onde um você pode entrar para sair pelo outro, e vice versa (isso é melhor compreendido ao jogar o jogo). Essa mecânica é relativamente simples de ser dominada, porém eles souberam diversificá-la tão bem que é como os desenvolvedores estivessem realmente experimentando sua própria tecnologia, já que muitas fases exigem algumas manobras com portais e também o uso de física e velocidade. Assim, Portal é uma excelente escolha caso aprecie um bom jogo de puzzle com uma boa história, fora isso que ele é praticamente obrigatório na sua biblioteca caso seja um fã de jogos da Valve.
Tenha um bom dia, tarde ou noite.

Portal is the highest ranked game on Steam. 
So... why are you even bothering to read the reviews? You already know that pretty much everybody here agrees the game is great.
It would be easier to just list the things I don't like. So I will do just that.

1) The challenge runs.
After beating the main game, a series of bonus maps are unlocked. These consist of advanced maps, which are just levels from the latter half of the game edited to be harder, and challenge runs, which are these same levels but you're limited in terms of either the number of portals you can place, the number of steps you can take, or the amount of time you can take.
Now, the limited portals run is great, as it adds another layer of puzzles on top of this puzzle game. Some great new game+ content! The timed run is a bit challenging and a bit annoying, but it's still a perfectly reasonable challenge to add. But the steps run, why is that in the game? It requires that you find the perfect route throughout the level, and not once make a mistake. Also, the step counter is super broken, I could do the same movement, but get numbers ranging from 2 to 5 steps. HOW!??!

2) Test chamber 18 is a bit annoying.

That's it.

Those are the only two issues I had with this game!

So what are you waiting for? Play it now!

A timeless classic, with solid puzzles and a decent story. While seeming overshadoweded by its sequel Portal is a great. Interestingly enough, despite the lack of variability, the joy and fun of replaying the game retains itself every playtrhough. Music is decent, and the voice acting is not commonly found but entertaining. Whiel the graphics are old, it still looks alot of fun and really establishes a dystopian tone when interacting with the secret gritty areas amongst smooth and shiny scenery. A great game to play and have, I highly reccomend getting this if your a fan of FPS and puzzles.

Gameplay 9/10

Music 7/10
Replayability 8/10
Overall 8/10
